ISSUE.TITLE: include arch/os in image libpod list
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Feature request description Today, ``` "Architecture": "arm64", "Os": "linux", ``` are only available when we inspect an image But usually this information is useful when we want to list images. For example to know if an image is using `amd64` or Apple Silicon computer, etc. so it requires one additional query for each image. ### Suggest potential solution Include ```json "Architecture": "arm64", "Os": "linux", ``` as part of `libpod/images/json` return this information could be with an additional query parameter to the endpoint `?arch=true&os=true`, `?displayArchAndOs`, whatever so opt-in query. ### Have you considered any alternatives? A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. ### Additional context Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #22260 from baude/validatepr [CI:DOCS]Initial PR validation

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Add os, arch, and ismanifest to libpod image list when listing images through the restful service, consumers want to know if the image they are listing is a manifest or not because the libpod endpoint returns both images and manifest lists. in addition, we now add `arch` and `os` as fields in the libpod endpoint for image listing as well.
